page.title: 13A FARM NEAR WELLS NORFOLK
page.content: New Farm consists of 1263 acres, 972 acres of arable and 291 acres of grass. Another 300 acres are hired. Over 1000 bullocks are kept for fattening, 250 cows for the dairy herd and calf breeding and a flock of 1000 sheep. 24 men are employed and they use a lot of machinery: Tractors include 9 Marshalls, 6 Leylands, 2 Renaults and 1 Nuffield and there are 2 Sanderson Teleporter forklifts. Crops include barley for malting and both barley and wheat are used as animal feed stuff. Sugar beet goes to Kings Lynn for processing. Carrots, cabbages and sprouts are the most important crops handled at the farm's vegetable station and then taken to market in the farm lorries. During the summer hay and silage are made.
